Dear ARUSD families,

We want to take time to reassure you that we continue working very closely with both, the County of Santa Clara Public Health Department and the Santa Clara County Office of Education (SCCOE).

At this moment, the risk from novel coronavirus (now named COVID-19) is low. Per the SCCOE, there are no immediate plans for school closures due to a spread of this virus.

We will continue to monitor and work closely to provide you with the most up to date and correct information. For the time being, we still recommend you:

1. Wash hands often with soap and warm water for at least 20 seconds.
2. Avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
3. Cover you coughs and sneezes with tissue and immediately dispose of the tissue in a trash can.

If you would like additional information, you can visit SCCOE’s website (https://www.sccoe.org/news/featured/Pages/Novel-Coronavirus-Information.aspx) or the County of Santa Clara Public Health Department’s website (https://www.sccgov.org/sites/phd/Pages/phd.aspx). #ARUSDCares

What a wonderful celebration of the grand opening of Hubbard Family Resource Center at Hubbard Media Arts Academy. We cannot thank our partners enough for helping us make this great resource center available to all families in our communities. Thank you, Catholic Charities of Santa Clara County, San Jose Public Library and First 5 Santa Clara County (First 5)!

We are excited to be able to share a video recap of the event soon! Here are some pictures of our ribbon-cutting ceremony and Dr. Bauer along with Paul Murphy from Supervisor Cindy Chavez's office; Cora Tomalinas, Board Member from First 5; Jolene Smith, CEO of First 5 and Councilmember Maya Esparza. #ARUSDrocks #ARUSDcares

Speed and velocity are quantity measures that can be applied in every day activities, movements and projects.

To learn more about these quantity measures, our 8th grade students at Joseph George built marble roller coasters. What's more fun than experiencing the rush while riding one in real life?

Check out the different prototypes using materials found in and out of school. Their creativity definitely burst through for this project! #ARUSDrocks
